Case reference: 2014004563.CaseDesc: Brian Nadeau and David Pushor were last seen on November 25, 2004 travelling together in a 1983 Honda Civic near Fort Assiniboine, Alberta. The vehicle was later recovered from the Athabasca river where Highway 661 crosses via an ice bridge in the winter. Mr. Nadeau and Mr. Pushor were not located.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Text "Love is kind, 69er, Devil"

Case reference: 2014003868.CaseDesc: On Sunday, April 18, 1976, at approximately 12:00 pm, Gary Michael Pinkney departed his residence in Fort Churchill, Manitoba on his snowmobile. He was destined for the Hudson Bay and had planned to return home that same evening. On April 19, 1976, at approximately 8:00 am, Helen Pinkney contacted the Churchill RCMP Detachment and reported that her husband had not yet returned home. Extensive searches were done of the area by land and by air for several days with negative results.   The remains of Mr. Pinkney have not been located and given his intended route, it is presumed that he drowned.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with black stone
Scar: 4 inch scar on either left or right leg
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Eagle with rising sun

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2021002686.CaseDesc: On January 12, 2021, shortly after 5:00 pm, Brock Curtis was last seen at the Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. Several witnesses observed Brock jumping into the falls, and being swept away.

Case reference: 2014004048.CaseDesc: Dwayne Allen Rideout was last seen on September 24, 1999 at the Generator Cabaret on 3rd Avenue in Prince George, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005806.CaseDesc: Roderic Maynard was last seen on Salt Spring Island, BC.  Mr. Maynard had personal issues and departed the area telling friends he intended on attending rehab for treatment of alcohol abuse.  Mr. Maynard is an avid sailor and has travelled all over the world.  Mr. Maynard was employed operating ferries around the Vancouver/Victoria area and would have no problem finding employment operating large water vessels or sail boats.  He is familiar with sailing all around the world and planned to retire in the St. Maarten area.

Mark: Left Cheek, large mole under eye

Case reference: 2014001333.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, members of the Canadian Armed Forces located the personal belongings of William Bereziuk washed up on an island in the Athabasca River 50 km north of Fort McMurray, Alberta. Mr. Bereziuk left Edmonton, Alberta in October of 1974 with the intention of making a canoe trip down the Athabasca River. He informed family members that he intended to spend the winter of 1974 in the Birch Mountain area of Alberta and would return to Edmonton in August of 1975. Mr. Bereziuk has never been heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Crucifix or scapular

Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2017020043.CaseDesc: Louis Judah Gonick was seen being picked up by taxi cab at his University dormitory residence at 7:09 PM, April 16, 2017, and was last seen at 7:32 PM, being dropped off at the Stanley Park causeway.

Case reference: 2013000058.CaseDesc: Marie-Berthe Perreault Astle Wiseman has been missing since June 26th 1975. She was last seen in her home located in the suburb of Pointe-Claire in Montreal, Quebec before mysteriously disappearring.

Case reference: 2014001607.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1979, Joseph Cohen was seen for the last time in Montreal. It was a Saturday night, he was out with friends at the Blanche Neige restaurant located in Côte-des-Neiges. His vehicle was located in a parking lot facing Valois Road.

Case reference: 2006018799.CaseDesc: Michael Recollet was last seen on August 20, 1991 at Okeechobee Lodge Dock, in Fraser Point. He was  heading in a westerly direction towards Birch Island by boat. His 16 foot cedar strip boat and 25HP Mariner motor were recovered near Mary's Point, Little La Cloche Island.

Case reference: 2011002999.CaseDesc: Donald Pringle was last seen on August 28, 2010. Donald takes medication and when he is not on his medication he becomes agitated and aggressive and makes poor decisions. Donald last had his medication on August 27. All family and friends have been interviewed and no one has seen or heard from Donald. He was last seen walking on Great Northern Road by Second Line East on August 28, 2010 at 2 pm.  At the time Donald was not carrying anything with him and was alone.

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006005099.CaseDesc: Gary Millerson was last seen at his residence in Port McNicoll on the 19 April 1991.

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2013000083.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1999, Jean-René Duguay was seen for the last time when he was seen jumping off the Lachapelle Bridge in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-René’s body was never found.

Case reference: 2021006090.CaseDesc: At the end of July, 2019, Jonathan Fowler was seen for the last time in Picton, Ontario. Since then, there has not been any activity on his banking, phone and social media accounts. During the time of his disappearance, Jonathan was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014004684.CaseDesc: Mr. Claude Gagné disappeared from the sector of Lac des Passes in a forested area near the municipality of La Tuque between September 1st and 2nd, 2000. His boat was found on the shore of the lake with the electric motor at the running position, and his car was found parked at the camp at the same lake. He went to the camp by himself and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2008000798.CaseDesc: Clare Kelly is schizophrenic, was not taking medications and was known to be despondent. She had a fascination with several relatives' deaths involving water. When picked up from Niagara Falls the previous week she said, "God told me to throw my body on the rocks to free my soul."

Coat: Blue, Bomber style parka with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2021047780.CaseDesc: Vincent McLean was last seen on October 1, 2021, at a rural property where he resided in Two Hills County, Alberta. There has been no activity from him since that date.

Case reference: 2014005498.CaseDesc: David Rocque was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 2010.  David was last heard from by a family member in March 2010.  Prior to David's disappearance, he normally maintained contact with his family at least once a month.  He resided in Edmonton but had spent time in northern Alberta, St. Paul area.

Scar: Left Cheek, 51mm close to the eye

Case reference: 2014003751.CaseDesc: Lucien Sale was last seen driving his truck in Chisholm, Alberta on September 21, 1991. On September 26, 1991, his truck was located abandoned on a logging road off into the bush.

Case reference: 2014003895.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1993, RCMP were advised Diana Thomas had fallen through the ice and had not surfaced. Diana was a passenger on a ski-doo along with her mother and a 13 year old driver. The threesome had only gone about 10 meters from shore when the back of the ski-doo went into the water, quickly followed by the front. Diana fell into the water with her mother and never resurfaced. Attempts were made to recover Diana, however all efforts met with negative results.

Case reference: 2006026499.CaseDesc: Simon McDonald was last seen on May 9, 2001, leaving his daughter's residence on the White Dog, First Nations Territory. He was known to enjoy walking along the river. Extensive searches of the area have failed to locate Mr. McDonald.

Hair: Black, Grey, Unkempt; Beard, Moustache, Sideburns
Shoes: Cloth, Red, Black, slippers with leather soles.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001739.CaseDesc: In March 1994, Joseph Bucar, having been laid off from Cassiar Mines years prior, had placed his furniture and effects in storage, accumulated credit card debt and disappeared from Kelowna BC.

Case reference: 2023064026.CaseDesc: Leah Keeper was last seen on July 25, 2023, on Selkirk Avenue in Winnipeg, Manitoba. She has not been in contact with her two children, which is out of the ordinary. Leah has not been seen or heard from since that date.

Case reference: 2014001288.CaseDesc: On November 9th, 1993, Violet Zarb was observed leaving her residence in Port Colborne, Ontario, shortly after 8:30 AM. Her vehicle was located on Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, Ontario the next day.  Violet's whereabouts remain unknown to this date. At the time of her disappearance, Violet was possibly wearing a black leather jacket and blue jeans.

Case reference: 2020011626.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1989, Ioan Sandea was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2014004493.CaseDesc: Guy Deschênes was last seen in June 2004 at his home located in Rivière-du Loup, Quebec. His vehicle was also found at his home. Guy has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016013379.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 a.m., Gilberto Cardinal-Fernandes was seen for the last time when he left his apartment to go for a walk in Gatineau, Quebec. Gilberto left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Worn in long Dreadlocks, long brown beard

Case reference: 2014005905.CaseDesc: Abraham Flett, was last seen around mid-August, 2012 in Thompson, Manitoba. He has not made contact with his family or his employer in Split Lake and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014002584.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1989, Carlo Dentoni was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Carlo sold antiques and travelled regularly to Italy. He completed his post-secondary education at universities in Calgary and England.

Case reference: 2023053313.CaseDesc: Kyle Hancock was last seen in St. Thomas, Ontario, on August 2, 2023. Kyle's phone hasn't been connected to any network since he was last observed, and his bank account hasn't been accessed.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2017072938.CaseDesc: On March 8, 1988, Nadine Sharp was seen for the last time. She was a student at the University of Toronto and went missing from her home in Etobicoke, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002009.CaseDesc: Leroy Marshall, AKA Roy Marshall, has been missing since July 23, 1979. Mr. Marshall moved in with his sister on the west side of Saint John in June of 1979. He had a job interview with the School District on July 23, 1979 but failed to show. Mr. Marshall lived in Somerville, Massachusetts, US, between 1961 and 1971.

Case reference: 2023004799.CaseDesc: Sheena Beaver was last seen in Calgary, Alberta in December 2022. At the time of her disappearance, Sheena was despondent.

Case reference: 2020007642.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1971, Ethel Crespo was last seen by her husband in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Ethel was two months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014001761.CaseDesc: Henrietta Mille is originally from Nain, Newfoundland and had been living in St. John’s, Newfoundland for quite some time before her disappearance. Henrietta was known to frequent the clubs in the St. John’s downtown area. Her keys, purse and other belongings were found at the Key Club.

Case reference: 2012020023.CaseDesc: Melanie Thomson was last seen on August 27, 2010. Melanie's last known address was in the downtown east side of Vancouver, B.C.

Case reference: 2014001816.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1981, Wayne Martin was seen for the last time while he was out for a walk at the Rideau Heights Campground in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2016062636.CaseDesc:
On November 6, 2016, Maxwell Harvey Mayling was reported missing from Prince George, British Columbia.  Mr. Mayling was last heard from in early October, 2016 by friends and family.  Mr. Mayling is known to frequent both the Prince George and Fort St John municipalities, and was last known to have been in Prince George since July 2016.

Mr. Mayling's maroon 1995 Ford Taurus was located in late November, 2016 in Prince George, however all other efforts to locate Mr. Mayling have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014004526.CaseDesc: In 1999, Jesse Jurak was seen for the last time as he attended a family funeral in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014003990.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, Yashar Ilkay and his wife went to bed for the night. When Yashar’s wife woke up the following morning, her husband was no longer in the residence. Yashar left his residence without his glasses, dentures and money. Yashar was last seen in the downtown Moncton, New Brunswick area.

Shirt: brown, white and blue long sleeve shirt

Case reference: 2013000139.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Clayton Condos. He was last seen on March 20, 2006, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006023799.CaseDesc: On July 12, 1999, Jerzy Ryglewicz was last seen at a gas station in Merrickville. He has not been seen or made contact with any friends or family since.

Case reference: 2014001434.CaseDesc: Mario Hudon was last seen on May 16, 1983, when he left his parents' home in Lévis, Quebec, on the south shore of Quebec City. Mario left some of his personal belongings at the residence.

Case reference: 2017004181.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2017, Glen Swanton was seen for the last time in the area of Minden Hills, Ontario.  Mr. Swanton’s abandoned vehicle was later located in the area of Kinmount, Ontario, on January 18, 2017.

Foreign Object: Left Wrist, Metal plate in his wrist

Case reference: 2008000499.CaseDesc: Kimberley Ann Amero was last seen at her residence in Saint John, New Brunswick on September 3, 1985. There has been no contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2022055316.CaseDesc: Jesse Strongarm was last seen in November 2021 in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. At the time of this disappearance, Jesse was living a high-risk lifestyle. After communicating with a friend in December 2021 Jesse has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2007003599.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2000 Marilyn Zaitzeff left her cottage located on Lambert Island, Lake Superior. She was operating a personal watercraft at the time. The watercraft was located overturned several hundred metres away from the cottage. Mrs. Zaitzeff has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003946.CaseDesc: Jean Siegel was seen for the last time on May 31, 1962 in Rivercrest, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014005913.CaseDesc: On October 27, 2012, Douglas Bender was seen for the last time in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba. He is known to frequent the downtown area. It is uncharacteristic for him not to be in contact with his family. At the time of his disappearance, Douglas was despondent.

Jacket: Grey, Brown, Winter/parka with fur-trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014005630.CaseDesc: Melissa Janette Ekkelenkamp was last seen on July 06, 2011 when she left the Alberta Hospital located in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2020012524.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1993, at approximately 2:45pm, Lois Dunlavy was seen for the last time as she attended the Scarborough General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Lois had been examined by a physician and when the physician returned to check on her, she was gone.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2020050890.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2020, days after the death of her son, Audrey Beaver was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. That day, Audrey had told her family that she planned on setting up a tent to live in.

Case reference: 2006011899.CaseDesc: Mr. McKay was last seen outside "Clarkes Tavern" in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on December 22, 1987.

Case reference: 2018046096.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2018, Victor Falk was seen for the last time after being dropped off at his residence in Rosthern, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Victor suffered from Alzheimer's disease.

Case reference: 2018045820.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1994, at approximately 1:30 pm, Subarangit Rajanehru was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004137.CaseDesc: On the night of October 5, 1976, Jean-Luc Ringuette was seen for the last time when he left his home in Sainte-Anne-de-Madawaska, New Brunswick. The following morning, Jean-Luc did not attend school. A few weeks prior to his disappearance, he had disclosed that he had some money, and that he and a friend were going to leave town.

Case reference: 2021038965.CaseDesc: On May 8, 2012, at approximately 11:25 a.m., Linda Manz was last seen near the area of Prospect Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, Linda was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020136.CaseDesc: Guy Verdon has been missing since March 24, 2010. On that day, he went to his daughter’s residence in Charlemagne, Quebec. He left her residence around 7:00 pm and was never seen again. Guy's associate, François Robillard also disappeared around the same time.

Teeth: False, Had partials, top and bottom
Chain: Gold, Gold, Pendant, medallion of the Holy Virgin
Watch: Gold, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Raymond Weil brand, two-tone bracelet
Amputation: Left Middle Finger, Tip of middle finger amputated

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014001684.CaseDesc: On June 30th, 1974 Brent Forsyth was 11 years of age when he went missing while fishing along the Bulkley River by Two Mile Creek in Hazelton BC. Brent was last seen upriver fishing a back-eddy. As a result of Brent's disappearance an extensive search involving community members, search and rescue, RCMP Police Dog Services and RCMP air service entailed. Despite these efforts and continued investigations he has never been located. Police have received new information about Brent and are seeking anyone who might have additional information about Brent's disappearance to come forward.

Deformity: Nick on the top right ear

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2023014476.CaseDesc: Paul Hahn left his Amherst, New York home on April 21st, 2022 to go kayaking on Lake Ontario near Golden State Hill Park, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, he was in possession of an orange and black Old Towne Sportsman motorized 120 kayak. His vehicle was located unoccupied in the state park however Paul has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Russell Peter Yellowbird was reported missing by his family in February 2015 after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for an extended period. It is believed that his last known location was in the downtown area of Edmonton, Alberta. Given the unusual circumstances of his disappearance, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest any foul play.

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Rufus Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2006019199.CaseDesc: Marion Thiessen was reported missing by her husband in November, 1979. She has gone missing several times in the past and it has been discovered that she lived in Vancouver, British Columbia about 28 years ago.  She contacted an acquaintance in 1984, but there has been no contact with Marion Thiessen since that time.

Teeth: False, Partial dentures on both lower and upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014004932.CaseDesc: Mathieu Daneau's disappearance occurred on April 3, 2007 in the region of St-Hyacinthe, Quebec. Mr. Daneau was admitted for treatment at the L'Envolée center. He left the center and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001464.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 16, 1989, Vincent Greene entered a wooded area behind his residence on the Red Head Rd, Saint John, NB, to search for the family dog. The dog returned shortly after he had left, but Vincent never returned.  An extensive ground search was conducted with negative results. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Steel rimmed
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Lines on both sides

Case reference: 2014002147.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 1981 Churchill RCMP received a call from Mrs. Esmoil advising her two sons, and two friends were late on returning from a canoe trip. On August 18th, 1981, Brian Dean Esmoil, his brother, and two friends headed out on an extended canoe trip from Leaf Rapids to Churchill. Numerous items, belonging to the men were found on shore. The bodies of three of the four travelers were recovered on the Churchilll River and death was due to drowning. The body of Brian Esmoil has never been recovered and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2023001782.CaseDesc: Félicien Laforce was last seen in November 2022 in the city of Longueuil, Québec, at the intersection of Chambly Road and Vauquelin Boulevard. It's known that Félicien likes to walk in parks and other green areas, as well as using public transportation. Cognitive deterioration appears to be plaguing him. For his safety and well-being, there are grounds for concern.

Coat: Black, Black winter jacket with white logo patch on the left shoulder
Black, Black winter jacket with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Albert Morris Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow in Manitoba. When he failed to return three days later, he was reported missing. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, his boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Albert has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that he drowned.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2021059091.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1988, Rocco Recchia was last seen carrying an overnight bag as he walked towards the train station on Lower Mill Street in Poughkeepsie, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, Rocco was despondent.
